body:
Is this really necessary? It seems kinda nice to have the disambiguation. This way it'd be clear to see if one builder on one computer was slower than the others (not that it'd be that interesting).

Right now stats are uploaded to `s3://static.rust-lang.org/build-metrics/<sha>/<builder>/<slave>/<name>.json`, which may just be difficult to browse because we can't list things in S3.

I suppose that gzipping would still be fine, but they're all generated at various times, so that may be hard. If we concatenate these all together I'd be in favor of still having the metadata of what builder/slave generated the stats.

They are currently uploaded with  `name` = `check-stage2-H-<host>-T-<target>-<crate>-metrics.json` and it is tricky to "guess" the host/target pair for each build target, especially doing it in a stable way as targets get added/removed (all the other info is easily accessible from the buildbot api).

This bug is just zipping `*.json` into a file with a fixed name, and uploading it to the `.../<slave>/` directory rather than just uploading the jsons directly.

Awesome!

BTW, It looks like it's tarring a whole directory tree:

```
$ tar xvf bench.tar.gz
tmp/build-metrics/auto-linux-32-opt/linux2/check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-bench-metrics.json
tmp/build-metrics/auto-linux-32-opt/linux2/check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-cfail-metrics.json
tmp/build-metrics/auto-linux-32-opt/linux2/check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-debuginfo-metrics.json
tmp/build-metrics/auto-linux-32-opt/linux2/check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-extra-metrics.json
tmp/build-metrics/auto-linux-32-opt/linux2/check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rfail-metrics.json
tmp/build-metrics/auto-linux-32-opt/linux2/check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rpass-full-metrics.json
tmp/build-metrics/auto-linux-32-opt/linux2/check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rpass-metrics.json
tmp/build-metrics/auto-linux-32-opt/linux2/check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rustc-metrics.json
tmp/build-metrics/auto-linux-32-opt/linux2/check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rustdoc-metrics.json
tmp/build-metrics/auto-linux-32-opt/linux2/check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rustpkg-metrics.json
tmp/build-metrics/auto-linux-32-opt/linux2/check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rustuv-metrics.json
tmp/build-metrics/auto-linux-32-opt/linux2/check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-std-metrics.json
tmp/build-metrics/auto-linux-32-opt/linux2/check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-syntax-metrics.json
$ tree tmp
tmp
`-- build-metrics
    `-- auto-linux-32-opt
        `-- linux2
            |-- check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-bench-metrics.json
            |-- check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-cfail-metrics.json
            |-- check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-debuginfo-metrics.json
            |-- check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-extra-metrics.json
            |-- check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rfail-metrics.json
            |-- check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rpass-full-metrics.json
            |-- check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rpass-metrics.json
            |-- check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rustc-metrics.json
            |-- check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rustdoc-metrics.json
            |-- check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rustpkg-metrics.json
            |-- check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-rustuv-metrics.json
            |-- check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-std-metrics.json
            `-- check-stage2-T-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-H-i686-unknown-linux-gnu-syntax-metrics.json
```

Not sure if this is on purpose? (It'd be neat to just zip the json files, or, at least, skip the `tmp/build-metrics` prefix.)
@alexcrichton has adjusted the `.tar.gz` to just include the `.json` files, with no nested directory structure; this is solved!
